Copy link below and send it via email, chat or any other way of communication to [EMAIL] to invite this person manually.
Here you can manage your members.
This person can do everything you can, including controlling this account. Usually your co-founder. Assign with caution!
Can only see the projects they're assigned to and add new things there.
Clients can't delegate or get assigned to tasks, but they can comment, start discussions, and upload files. You can also hide tasks, discussions, notes or files from them.
Invited by [NAME]. ([TIME]), not logged in yet.
Here you can invite one or more members to join your company.

You can not add user to any project since you are not creator or project lead of any.
You are about to send company to the archive. Any users assigned under this company will be archived as well.
There aren't any people or companies in the archive. If you move a company or a user to the archive, they'll be kept in the system, but won't be able to log in to your Freelance Manager.
Here you can manage your site staff members roles and privileges.

Default currency is set in system administration, however you can set different currency for each client. This setting affects time tracking records and invoicing for this client.
Here you can add new company.
Here you can update company settings.

You can group people into teams - you'll then be able to select them all at once when creating a project or subscribing them to a task.
Choose who to add to this team:
Here you can manage your teams.
There aren't any teams yet. You can create different teams (eg. Designers, Developers). Then, next time you need to select a group, you'll be able to choose a team.
All team members are processed successfully.
If you have many projects, choose a category to stay organized.
See everything that you and your team are working on.

The label shows what stage the project is in.

Start your first project and invite people to join your [COMPANY]

Skip and go to the Project
You can invite members, subcontractors, teams and clients to work with you on this project
Members can see and create everything in the project. You can choose a leader ([ICON]) who'll be able to manage this project.
Clients can leave comments and create discussions, notes, or files. They can't be assigned to tasks or create new ones themselves.

This action will move this invoice to archive. Are you sure you want to do this?
That means reminder emails won't be sent to clients when the invoice is overdue.
Are you sure you wish to disable overdue reminders for this invoice?
That means reminder emails will be sent to clients when the invoice is overdue.
Are you sure you wish to enable overdue reminders for this invoice?
Private comments are invisible to clients and don't appear on the invoice PDF.
The note will appear at the bottom of the invoice PDF. It can contain additional information, payment details or a thank you message.
Here you can create a new invoice.
Here you can edit current invoice.
Here you can duplicate current invoice.
Here you can manually assign payment for the invoice.
Too many Invoice items. Maximum allowed 10.

The information displayed below is collected from a variety of locations, and summarized here so that you may be able to conveniently find some of the information required when trying to diagnose a problem or request help with your FM v.[VER] installation.
Who can see this calendar beside you?
Enter your currency such as CAD, USD, EUR
Here you can view and manage important aspects of your site configuration options.
Locales are used for displaying dates in your own language format.
Illegal file type. Only jpg and png file types allowed.
If no logo exists, Company Name will be used instead
Use PHP Mailer or SMTP protocol for sending emails
Default number of items used for pagination
Ask your hosting company for sandmail path if unsure. Usually: /usr/sbin/sendmail -t -i
Mail server port ( Can be 25, 26. 456 for GMAIL. 587 for Yahoo ). Ask your host if uncertain.
Choose Yes if your server requires SSL connection

Oops!!! You have come to the wrong link.
We use them to give you the best experience.
If you continue using our website, we'll assume that you are happy to receive all cookies on this website.
Contact skilled freelancers within minutes. View profiles, ratings, portfolios and chat with them. Pay the freelancer only when you are 100% satsified with their work.
Upload any files that might be helpful in explaining your your brief here
What skill level do you require from developers?
Agree on a price and release payment when the job is done. Best for one-off tasks.
Hire based on an hourly rate and pay for hours billed. Best for ongoing work.

How many hours are you available in a week?
What is your current employment type?
